availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To the excelence of Beria Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner James Cutburth wold Respectifull Represent to your exelence that at the January term of the Whitley Quarterly ^courte^ 1862 that they was a warret Returned against him for Keeping a tipling hous and that a judgment was Render against the your petitioner for the sum of $60,, Your petitioner states that he had ben a tavern Keeper for some time and that a few day's previous to the Whitley his licens had expired he states that he had no intention of violating the law and you petitioner state that he is a pore man and has if he has to pay said fine that he it will put him in greate troble and cause him to sacefise his property he states that it will be a mater of greate charity to Remit said fine he prays your Petitioner excelence to Remit said fine and for all proper Releaf
James Cutburth says he beleaves the statements, in the foregoing petition he beleaves to be true

James Cutbirth
Sworn to before me by James Cutbirth this the 30 day of January 1862
L D Sutton P J W C
The under signed says that they believe that it wold be a mater ^act^ of charity to Remit said fine

J. C. Foley
william peablr
W. H. Wilson
D H Leforce
James M Siler
S P Braunn
A. C. King
A F. Campbell
Samuel Denham
H. S. Tye
W G Tye
I believe you would be doing nothing wrong by remitting the within fine and that your course in so doing would be endorsed by this community

Remission made out March 6" 1862 N G,
$60.
